com.guimonsters.client

Class Command

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.guimonsters.client.Command

  • public class Command
extends java.lang.Object
    A class that represents a game command. Commands contain a parent object, a name, a description (used to populate the help menu), and Method object that they invoke when executed.
    Version:
    1.00, 2013-04-18
    Author:
    Elijah Atkinson

    • Constructor Detail

      • Command

        public Command(java.lang.Object o,
       java.lang.String n,
       java.lang.String d,
       java.lang.String e,
       java.lang.reflect.Method m)
        Create a new Command instance.
        Parameters:
        o - The Object this command belongs to.
        n - The String name of this command.
        d - The String description of this command. Used to populate help message.
        e - The String error message to display when the command is used wrong.
        m - The Method object that this command executes.

    • Method Detail

      • execute

        public java.lang.String execute(java.lang.String args)
        Attempt to execute the command and return a string.
        Parameters:
        args - The String parameter to pass to the command method. Empty or null strings will be ignored and the command will be executed without arguments.
        Returns:
        results The String containing results of command execution. Results will be null if the command executes a method with void return type.

      • execute

        public java.lang.String execute()
        Attempt to execute the command without parameters and return a string.
        Returns:
        results The String containing results of command execution. Results will be null if the command executes a method with void return type or if the command execution failed.
